Lease Debt (my estimate)

Aggregated value of present value of lease commitments reported in financial statements, using the pre-tax cost of debt (my estimate) as the discount rate. (Lease commitments beyond year 5 converted into annual lease payments for extended period).
Lease commitments are debt, and the conversion to debt should be at the pre-tax cost of debt.
Millions of US $
Conventional Debt
Aggregated value of all interest bearing debt, reported on balance sheet, including short term borrowings and long term borrowings.
Consistent with defintiion of what should go into debt in a company's cost of capital.
Millions of US $
Total Debt with leases
Sum of lease debt (my estimate) and conventional debt.
Total debt used in computing cost of capital.
Millions of US $
Interest Expense
Aggregated value of interest expenses of all firms in industry group, as reported in income statements.
This is the interest expense from interest-bearning (conventional) debt.
Millions of US $
Book Interest rate
Aggregated value of interest expenses/ Aggregated value of conventional (interest-bearing) debt.

This should not be used in the cost of capital calculations, as pre-tax cost of debt, but a comparison to the estimated pre-tax cost of debt (based upon default risk) can help estimate whether the market value of debt is higher or lower than book value.
Percent
Short term Debt as % of Total Debt
Aggregated Short term (<1 year) debt as percent of aggregated conventional (interest-bearning) debt.
Measures usage of short term debt in financing, for good (matching asset duration) or bad (trying to plat yield curve) reasons.
Percent
Lease Debt (Accounting)

Starting in 2019, IFRS and GAAP are requiring that lease commitments be reported as debt. Since the accounting rules for what should be counted as lease commitments and the discount rate used to get present value are different from mine, this number can be different from my estimate.
Check on whether accounting lease debt rules are being consistently applied and whether there are loopholes that companies are using to evade these rules.
Millions of US $
table_summary: This table provides financial statistics related to debt and interest expenses for various industries. It includes the number of firms in each industry, estimates of lease debt, conventional debt, total debt including leases, interest expenses, book interest rates, the proportion of short-term debt as a percentage of total debt, and lease debt accounting values. The data helps in understanding the debt structure and financial health of different industries.
